text_overlay_intent: The text demands a high-prestige, blockbuster cinematic experience that balances the technical 'Action' of racing with the 'Intensity' of Hollywood star power and professional dominance.
dominant_narrative: The relentless pursuit of professional excellence and the high-stakes adrenaline of elite Formula 1 racing.

Intro.supporting_material: Technical details of the car and track preparation.
Intro.intent_diluting_material: Generic crowd shots or wide scenic views without a human anchor.
Intro.reasoning: The intro must establish the 'Star' and the 'Stakes.' We need to see the focus in the driver's eyes or the precision of the machine to justify the cinematic scale.

Build-up.supporting_material: Pit crew activity, starting grid tension, and mechanical movement.
Build-up.intent_diluting_material: Static interviews or slow-moving urban scenery.
Build-up.reasoning: This stage functions as the transition from preparation to performance. The energy must climb through rhythmic mechanical sequences and the anticipation of the race start.

Peak.supporting_material: Crashes, high-speed overtakes, and POV cockpit perspectives.
Peak.intent_diluting_material: Celebratory shots or slow-motion reflections that break the kinetic flow.
Peak.reasoning: The peak is about the 'Relentless' nature of the sport. It requires the highest kinetic energy and visual density to simulate the sensory overload of a race.

Outro.supporting_material: Podium celebrations, fireworks, and brand-identifying urban landmarks.
Outro.intent_diluting_material: Continued high-speed racing footage that prevents the narrative 'Release'.
Outro.reasoning: The outro provides the 'Button' to the experience. It must transition from the danger of the peak to the prestige and celebration of victory.

strengths: Strong presence of the primary subject (Brad Pitt/Drivers).
Excellent variety of night-time racing with high-contrast lighting.
editorial_tradeoffs: The scarcity of 'Low' energy clips forces a consistently aggressive pace, sacrificing quiet character moments for constant momentum.
constraint_gaps: Limited 'Medium' energy establishing shots makes the transition from Intro to Build-up very abrupt.

editorial_strategy: The edit will prioritize a 'Relentless' pace, using the star power of the lead actors to anchor the high-octane racing action. We will lean into the Teal-Orange filmic grade by favoring night-time racing and high-contrast garage scenes to maintain a premium, cinematic aesthetic.
remake_strategy: To achieve a true Director's Cut, I would integrate more intimate, low-energy dialogue scenes to ground the spectacle. Adding more 'Place-Nature' or 'Place-Indoor' shots would provide the necessary breathing room to make the 'Peak' action feel even more explosive.

editorial_motifs.trigger: Mechanical start lights or steering wheel adjustments
